The description was accurate. The host was friendly and responsive. We spent all of our time at the house and cooked all our meals there. The kitchen was stocked well except no measuring cups or spoons.
On arrival the house was 53 degrees downstairs with a faulty digital thermostat. It was even colder upstairs. We called the host and after trying to troubleshoot over the phone he sent over a Mr. Fixit who got the furnace going. The next day Mr. Fixit returned as the upstairs was still too cold. The next two nights were comfortable for all. We appreciated the host's prompt response, the requested space heater for the coldest upstairs room and the offer by the host of a refund for the first night's stay.
We would stay at this home again but probably not in winter!

We just returned from a 2 night stay at Nadine's. When we pulled up to the house, we were beyond delighted. The house is nestled between 3 fields of corn rows and capped with a gorgeous oak tree and flower gardens, making it a truly hidden treasure. You're surrounded by garden beds, rows of raspberry bushes and a pumpkin patch.
Nadine greeted us, and gave us a tour of the home, which is built around an old stone fireplace. The architecture is such a warm and inviting bit of history, and the space is filled with comfortable seating and a kitchen filled with all the essentials for cooking. During the tour Nadine shared some great stories about the home, which we loved.
There is a huge fire pit outside that we used on Friday (because the rest of the weekend forecast was rain), and firewood was available to purchase. We also made the most of the weather and ate our dinner outside on the picnic table. You're very conveniently located to restaurants (We had an old fashioned at Jim & Linda's Supper Club and can't wait to try it again for dinner).
The bed was very comfortable, but we spent most of our time in the kitchen, making meals, having wine and enjoying all the weather (even the non stop rain). Our favorite moment was Saturday night after the rain slowed down, and we walked around the grounds at dusk. I have never seen as many fireflies at one time as I did last night. It was magical.
We appreciated the small details made to ensure our comfort, and have already checked our scheduled to see if we can make another stay.
One thing to note, there is a renter who stays in the garden level of the home. They are not there often, and we briefly met them in passing a few times and they are delightful. We only mention this because you can hear one another.
In any case, we hands down are looking forward to renting the home again, and can't wait to be there again!

This was my second Airbnb experience and it was amazing. I felt like I was transported to a vacation home in Colorado when I entered the quiet and peaceful neighborhood. Yet the location turned out to have easy access to dining, grocery stores, Starbucks, and my work-All of these were just a few short minutes away. The home was located atop a modest slope tucked-in a heavily wooded area just on the edge of Fond Du Lac.
Pamela and Belinda were fantastic hosts. Belinda was there to greet me at the door and gave me a quick tour of this amazing home. I felt like I was in a luxury mansion beautifully decorated throughout. The backyard had a relaxing area in the back of the home with a serene fountain that transitioned gracefully into the treeline.
The Kennedy Loft was perfect for me and exceeded my expectations for a loft area. It looked like a newly remolded area that served as a cozy hideaway from the worries of the day. A large tv with accompanying remote was available in the loft along with a fan that I used sparingly during my lengthy stay. There was a more private sitting area just below my loft with a mini-refrigerator, Kuerig coffee machine, and requisite k-cups. Bottled water was thoughtfully restocked in the mini-fridge. I had space to store a few items to tide me over. Although this area was available to other guests in the home, I found it available and quiet when I wanted to get some work I wanted to get done for the next day.
I had minor difficulty logging into the wifi and in less than 3 minutes, Pamela responded via text and Belinda was sitting across from me diligently working on my question.
I would say this was an excellent experience in a beautiful resort style home with many beautifully decorated areas to concentrate, relax, or just enjoy the zen of where you are. I highly recommend Belinda and Pamela for their thoughtful, considerate, client-centered approach to guaranteeing a flawless stay. They will give you space to do your thing (which I prefer) or engage in pleasant conversation as I did with Belinda over some comfort food one evening.
I actually am going back very soon for another lengthy stay related to my work. That's recommendation enough.
Thank you
